poem:
### A Dream Built by Hand

In the shambles of desire,  
Jess and Rick wield hammer  
and hope,  
plaster dreams on naked walls,  
stitch homes from forsaken corners.  
Disheartened no more,  
they coax warmth  
from cold foundations,  
craft love from splintered ruins—  
nail by nail, breath within dust,  
a heartbeat echoing,  
"ours."
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘Our hard work was worth it’: is a fixer-upper the best way to a dream home? When Jess and Rick Sowerby started searching for their first home in 2018, they had not considered a fixer-upper. But after 30 viewings without finding their dream home, it was time for a change of plan. “I was getting disheartened – I thought we’d never find anything,” says Jess, 33. “Some houses were lovely but weren’t to our taste.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
